definitions: causing confusion by being difficult to understand or explain clearly
introducing unwanted variables that obscure true relationships between factors being studied
examples: The confounding results left researchers scratching their heads
This confounding puzzle has stumped experts for decades
Smoking is a confounding factor in this health study
Researchers must control for confounding variables in experiments

definitions: showing a tendency to challenge or oppose others in an aggressive manner
examples: His confrontational attitude made the meeting unnecessarily tense
She adopted a confrontational stance toward management

definitions: unable to think clearly or understand what is happening around you
lacking organization or clear arrangement of elements or parts
examples: The confused patient couldn't remember where she was
He gave a confused explanation of the events
The confused mass of papers covered the entire desk
Their confused accounts made the audit extremely difficult

definitions: making someone unable to think clearly or understand something properly
examples: The confusing instructions led to multiple assembly errors
These confusing road signs have caused several accidents

definitions: having a pleasant and friendly personality that makes others comfortable
naturally suited or appropriate for someone's character or abilities
examples: The congenial host made everyone feel welcome immediately
She found congenial companions at the book club
Teaching proved a congenial occupation for her creative spirit
The tropical climate was congenial to growing orchids

definitions: describing a condition or disease present from birth due to heredity or prenatal development
appearing to be naturally present as if from birth rather than acquired
examples: The baby was diagnosed with a congenital heart defect
Congenital disorders affect millions of children worldwide
He's a congenital liar who can't tell the truth
She seems to be a congenital optimist about everything

definitions: having too much traffic or too many people causing movement difficulties
blocked or filled with mucus making breathing difficult
examples: The congested highways delayed commuters for several hours
Downtown streets become congested during rush hour
Her congested sinuses made sleeping difficult last night
The congested airways required immediate medical attention

definitions: consisting of many different and distinct parts or aspects grouped together
examples: The conglomerate rock contained fragments of various minerals
This conglomerate organization spans multiple unrelated industries

definitions: conveying praise or good wishes for someone's success or good fortune
examples: She received many congratulatory messages after her promotion
The congratulatory speech praised the team's dedication

definitions: relating to a religious system where individual churches govern themselves independently
examples: The congregational church allows members to vote on decisions
Their congregational structure gives local churches complete autonomy

definitions: relating to or involving a formal legislative assembly, especially the US Congress
examples: The congressional hearing lasted for three days straight
Congressional approval ratings hit a new low this year

definitions: having exactly the same shape and size when superimposed
showing logical agreement or consistency between elements or ideas
examples: These two triangles are congruent in every dimension
The congruent figures can be perfectly overlapped
Her actions were congruent with her stated values
The findings are congruent with previous research results

definitions: having the shape of a cone or relating to cones
examples: The conic sections include circles, ellipses, and parabolas
This conic projection preserves angles but distorts areas

definitions: having a circular base that tapers evenly to a point
examples: The wizard wore a tall conical hat
Conical flasks are commonly used in chemistry laboratories

definitions: describing trees that produce cones and have needle-shaped or scale-like leaves
examples: The coniferous forest stretched for miles across the mountain
Coniferous trees dominate the northern boreal regions

definitions: based on incomplete information or guesswork rather than certain knowledge
examples: His conjectural theory lacked any supporting evidence
The conjectural nature of the claim made it unreliable

definitions: united or connected physically, especially describing twins sharing body parts
examples: The conjoined twins were successfully separated after surgery
These conjoined structures share a common foundation wall

definitions: joined together or acting together in combination or partnership
examples: Their conjoint efforts produced remarkable results this quarter
The conjoint analysis revealed consumer preference patterns

definitions: relating to the relationship between married partners, especially intimate aspects
examples: The prison allows conjugal visits once per month
They enjoyed conjugal bliss for fifty years together

definitions: joined together through chemical bonds in alternating single and double bonds
modified in form to express different grammatical categories like tense or person
examples: The conjugated proteins contain non-protein chemical groups attached
Conjugated molecules show unique optical properties
The conjugated verb forms express different tenses in Spanish
Students must memorize conjugated forms of irregular verbs

definitions: joined or linked together physically or through a network system
having many influential social or professional relationships
examples: All computers are connected through the central server
The connected devices can share data instantly
She's well connected in the fashion industry circles
His connected family helped him secure the position

definitions: serving to connect or join things together, especially tissue or words
examples: Connective tissue holds organs in place throughout the body
These connective words link the main ideas together

definitions: secretly planning to do something immoral, illegal, or harmful to others
examples: The conniving employee stole company secrets for competitors
Her conniving nature eventually alienated all her friends

definitions: showing great care and attention to detail in one's work or duties
examples: The conscientious student always submitted perfect assignments on time
She's a conscientious worker who never cuts corners

definitions: awake and able to understand what is happening around you
done deliberately with full awareness of what you are doing
examples: The patient remained conscious throughout the entire procedure
She was barely conscious after the accident
He made a conscious effort to improve his health
This was a conscious decision to change careers

definitions: formally dedicated to a religious or divine purpose through ceremony
examples: The consecrate ground cannot be used for secular purposes
These consecrate vessels are used only during communion

definitions: made or declared sacred through religious ceremony or dedication
examples: The consecrated bread is distributed during the service
They buried him in consecrated ground

definitions: following each other continuously in uninterrupted succession or order
examples: She won three consecutive championships in her career
It rained for five consecutive days last week

definitions: agreed to by all people involved, especially in intimate or legal matters
examples: The contract requires consensual agreement from both parties
All activities must be consensual between adult participants

definitions: willing to allow or agree to something, especially between adults
examples: The law applies only to consenting adults
Both consenting parties signed the agreement yesterday

definitions: happening as a direct result or consequence of something else
examples: The flood and consequent damage cost millions in repairs
His injury and consequent absence affected team performance

definitions: having important effects or results, especially in the future
examples: This consequential decision will affect generations to come
The most consequential election in recent history

definitions: favoring traditional values and resistant to change or innovation
deliberately lower than probable or showing careful restraint
examples: His conservative views oppose most social reforms
The conservative party won the recent election
These conservative estimates suggest at least 10% growth
She took a conservative approach to investing

definitions: maintained in its original or existing state through evolution or time
protected from harm, decay, or loss through careful preservation
examples: This highly conserved gene sequence appears across species
The conserved protein structure suggests important functionality
The carefully conserved artifacts remain in excellent condition
These conserved wetlands provide critical wildlife habitat

definitions: large enough in size, amount, or importance to be worth noting
examples: She invested considerable time in learning the language
The project requires considerable financial resources to complete

definitions: showing careful thought about how your actions affect other people
examples: Her considerate neighbor always keeps the music volume low
It was considerate of him to call ahead

definitions: arrived at after careful thought and deliberation rather than impulse
examples: After considered reflection, she declined the job offer
His considered opinion carries significant weight here

definitions: acting or done in the same way over time without variation
compatible or in agreement with something else
examples: Her consistent performance earned her a promotion
The team needs more consistent results to qualify
Your story isn't consistent with the evidence found
These findings are consistent with our hypothesis

definitions: combined or merged into a single more effective or coherent whole
examples: The consolidated report includes data from all departments
They moved to a consolidated office location downtown

definitions: in agreement or harmony with something else in a pleasing way
examples: Her actions were consonant with her stated principles
The design is consonant with traditional architectural styles

definitions: clearly visible or attracting notice, especially due to being unusual
examples: His conspicuous absence from the meeting was noted
She wore conspicuous jewelry to the gala event

definitions: relating to or suggesting a secret plan by a group to do something harmful
examples: He spoke in conspiratorial whispers about the plan
Her conspiratorial wink suggested she knew the secret

definitions: remaining the same over a period of time without variation
happening continuously or repeatedly without pause or interruption
examples: The temperature remained constant throughout the experiment
Her constant support helped him through difficult times
The constant noise from construction disturbed the neighbors
He was under constant pressure to meet deadlines

definitions: being a part of a whole, especially an essential or component part
examples: Carbon is a constituent element of all organic compounds
These constituent parts must be assembled in order

definitions: formally set up or established, especially through legal or official means
examples: The properly constituted committee has full decision-making authority
A legally constituted government must follow constitutional procedures

definitions: relating to or allowed by a country's constitution or fundamental laws
relating to someone's physical or mental condition
examples: The court ruled the law was constitutional
Constitutional rights protect citizens from government overreach
She takes a daily constitutional walk for health
His constitutional weakness made him susceptible to illness

definitions: having the power to establish or give organized form to something essential
examples: These constitutive elements define the compound's properties
Language plays a constitutive role in human thought

definitions: severely restricted or limited in freedom, action, or expression
examples: She felt constrained by traditional social expectations
The constrained budget limited their options significantly

definitions: limiting or restricting someone or something's freedom or development
examples: These constraining regulations stifle business innovation significantly
The constraining effect of poverty limits educational opportunities

definitions: made narrower or tighter, especially by squeezing or compression
examples: His constricted airways made breathing extremely difficult
The constricted blood vessels reduced circulation significantly
